intro: Mimosa cisparanensis, commonly known as the Brazilian mimosa, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, thriving in well-drained soils. It has a spreading growth habit and is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value. The leaves are sensitive to touch, curling when disturbed, a trait shared with other mimosa species.
